Dear Sir/Madam,

I am a Hong Konger, who is writing to complain about that a Hong Kong student of your accounting and finance programme (Year 2), namely Samantha Wong (or Samantha Wang), violated the Hong Kong government's self-quarantine policy.

According to her Instagram story, she went to the Wan Chai MTR station less than 14 days after she arrived in Hong Kong. Considering that the COVID-19, which has become pandemic, is extremely infective, this selfish, irresponsible behavior poses a great threat to all the Hong Kongers' health and safety. It also ruins the prestige of your department, as well as LSE as a whole.

I would very much appreciate it if you can take prompt disciplinary actions to show that such behavior cannot be tolerated. Attached are the evidence provided by the netizens of the LIHKG forum.

Yours faithfully,
Anonymous
